sections.heading: Terms, defined.For purposes of sections 14-101 to 14-2004:(1) Lot means a lot as described and designated upon the recorded plat of a city of the metropolitan class, and in case there is no recorded plat of any such city, a lot as described and designated upon any generally recognized map of such ci
sections.text: Terms, defined.For purposes of sections 14-101 to 14-2004:(1) Lot means a lot as described and designated upon the recorded plat of a city of the metropolitan class, and in case there is no recorded plat of any such city, a lot as described and designated upon any generally recognized map of such city;(2) Lands means any unsubdivided real estate in a city of the metropolitan class; and(3) Street includes boulevards, avenues, alleys, lanes, or any form of public roadway in a city of the metropolitan class.SourceLaws 1921, c. 116, art. IV, § 31, p. 485;C.S.1922, § 3657;C.S.1929, § 14-534;R.S.1943, § 14-543;Laws 2022, LB800, § 193.AnnotationsRight-of-way of railroad crossing street at an angle was subject to special assessment. Chicago & N.W. Ry. Co. v. City of Omaha, 154 Neb. 442, 48 N.W.2d 409 (1951).
